awd_titl_txt: Dynamics of Electronically Excited States.  Models for      Chemical Reactivity
awd_abstract_narration: The Experimental Physical Chemistry Program supports the                        research group of Professor Pratt in a continued investigation                  of high-resolution electronic spectroscopy of large organic                     molecules.  The information gained from these investigations is                 leading to significant quantitative tests and dramatic                          qualitative improvements in our understanding of intermolecular                 energy flow in large molecules.                                                                                                                                 At the studied excitation energies of 3-4 eV and the                            spectroscopic resolution of a few MHz, the discrete                             spin-rotation-vibration energy levels of excited electronic                     states are imbedded in a higher density manifold (or even a                     quasi-continuum) of levels belonging to one or more lower                       electronic states.  Couplings between these manifolds permit                    rapid occurrence of chemically interesting processes; the                       research attempts to extract information about these couplings                  from eigenstate-resolved spectra.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
